sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
An enumeratedValue is:

  enumeratedTypeId . enumeratedId
sections.text_content:
An enumeratedValue is:
Â enumeratedTypeId . enumeratedId

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The values of an enumerated type are written as the type name (enumeratedTypeId) followed by a dot followed by one of the enumerated values of the type (enumeratedId).
sections.text_content: The values of an enumerated type are written as the type name (enumeratedTypeId) followed by a dot followed by one of the enumerated values of the type (enumeratedId).
sections.mdown_content: The values of an enumerated type are written as the type name (_enumeratedTypeId_) followed by a dot followed by one of the enumerated values of the type (_enumeratedId_).

sections.title: Example
code:
type color : enum (red, green, blue)
        var c : color := color . red
        var d : color := succ (c)       % d becomes green
sections.text_content: In this example, color.red is an enumeratedValue.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The above description has been simplified by ignoring the possibility that the enum type can be exported from a module. If this is the case, each use of one of the enumerated values outside of module M must be preceded by the module name and a dot, as in M.color.red.
sections.text_content: The above description has been simplified by ignoring the possibility that the enum type can be exported from a module. If this is the case, each use of one of the enumerated values outside of module M must be preceded by the module name and a dot, as in M.color.red.
sections.mdown_content: The above description has been simplified by ignoring the possibility that the **enum** type can be exported from a **module**. If this is the case, each use of one of the enumerated values outside of module _M_ must be preceded by the module name and a dot, as in _M_._color_._red_.
